comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: David Lamar, aka "the Wolf of Wall Street," served a federal prison sentence in 1916 for impersonating a Congressman on the phone; indicted for theft in 1922; again arrested in 1933 for grand larceny.  Died in poverty in a New York hotel room in January 1934.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Lamar's defense attorney in 1913 was Edward Lauterbach, who appears in two of these Bain News photos: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3682655288/in/p... www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3681840897/in/p...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I have added him to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lamar

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for the interesting information on David Lamar.  We will add the information to the description and update the database.  We will update the description for the images of Edward Lauterbach too, noting his connection to Lamar.

comment._content: The same photo in: The Daily Missoulian., July 11, 1913, Morning, Page 7
